comments.body: I could just use `FATAL_ERROR` here and undo the change to node_internals.h but I figured it might be nice to distinguish between "normal" fatal errors and ones from the esm module loader.

I do not know in what way this legacy mode should work or not but the original implementation also checks for `package.json` in directories and resolves the `main` entry afterwards. I see that there is some part that checks for this but I do not know if it is related or not but I do not think so.
Yes, this path is just for the main only, since that must always be backwards compatible, while the other path under the resolution flag Node.js mode handles directories.
